Package com.github.actionfx.core.annotation

Annotation Type AFXCellValueConfig

  • @Repeatable(AFXTableColumns.class)
@Target(FIELD)
@Retention(RUNTIME)
public @interface AFXCellValueConfig
    Annotation that can be applied at field level to configure tables/table columns and what data shall be displayed there and how.

    The annotation can be applied on:

    • TableView or TreeTableView for configuring the contained columns without the need to have the columns itself injected via @FXML
    • TableColumn or TreeTableColumn for configuring the annotated column directly
    • TreeView
    • ListView
    Author:
    koster

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      java.lang.Class<? extends javafx.scene.control.IndexedCell> cellType
      An optional cell type to set for the given cell to configure.
      java.lang.String colId
      The name of the column to configure.
      int colIdx
      The index of the column to configure (0-based).
      boolean editable
      Flag that indicates whether the user shall be able to edit cell data in the table column directly or not.
      java.lang.String propertyValue
      The property value that is used to configure a PropertyValueFactory or TreeItemPropertyValueFactory as a cell-value factory for the column to configure.
      java.lang.Class<? extends javafx.util.StringConverter> stringConverter
      An optional string converter class that shall be used to convert the backed domain objects value under propertyValue() into a displayable string in the table column and convert it back from a string to the property's data type.

    • Element Detail

      • colId

        java.lang.String colId
        The name of the column to configure. This field is mandatory, if applied on a TableColumn or TreeTableColumn and no value in colIdx() is given.

        The field is meaningless, when the annotation is applied on TableColumn or TreeTableColumn field directly.

        Returns:
        the name of the column ("id")
        Default:
        ""

      • colIdx

        int colIdx
        The index of the column to configure (0-based). This field is mandatory, if applied on a TableColumn or TreeTableColumn and no value in colId() is given.

        The field is meaningless, when the annotation is applied on TableColumn or TreeTableColumn field directly.

        Returns:
        the name of the column ("id")
        Default:
        -1

      • propertyValue

        java.lang.String propertyValue
        The property value that is used to configure a PropertyValueFactory or TreeItemPropertyValueFactory as a cell-value factory for the column to configure. This field is mandatory, when annotating fields of type TableView, TableColumn, TreeTableView or TreeTableColumn.

        For fields of type TreeView and ListView it must remain empty, because the components do not allow accessing single Java bean properties for displaying. For these components, using a stringConverter() must be used.

        Returns:
        the name of the property to use for a PropertyValueFactory
        Default:
        ""

      • stringConverter

        java.lang.Class<? extends javafx.util.StringConverter> stringConverter
        An optional string converter class that shall be used to convert the backed domain objects value under propertyValue() into a displayable string in the table column and convert it back from a string to the property's data type.
        Returns:
        the string converter class to use
        Default:
        javafx.util.StringConverter.class

      • cellType

        java.lang.Class<? extends javafx.scene.control.IndexedCell> cellType
        An optional cell type to set for the given cell to configure.
        Returns:
        the cell type to use (e.g. CheckBoxTableCell)
        Default:
        javafx.scene.control.IndexedCell.class

      • editable

        boolean editable
        Flag that indicates whether the user shall be able to edit cell data in the table column directly or not. The default is false (no editing).
        Returns:
        true, if the cell data can be edited by the user, false, if the data is not editable. Default is false.
        Default:
        false
